item.dc:creator: @Bebemycat2 Bebe
item.description:
@Bebemycat2 wrote:

I like bitmaps, I only use DTM’s in certian situations. I used to use it to identify the shap of objects, but now I use Bitmapmasks mostly.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with FindDeformedBitmapToleranceIn function. :(
item.dc:creator: @Mad_Cow Mad Cow
item.description:
@Mad_Cow wrote:

Bebemycat2:

Ok, you have a whole number(integer) for the “accuracy” but this variable is an extended number so it should be “5.0”

Actually it wouldn’t have made a difference from what I tested. Accuracy is the result of how accurate it is and it saves the result as an “extended”. It shouldn’t lag too much unless you was searching the whole screen which you obviously must have.

But yea, I find DTM’s alot easier too

Mad Cow

Read full topic

I find it easier just using DTMs lol. Thank you very much Mad and Bebe.

item.title: Help with FindDeformedBitmapToleranceIn function. :(
item.dc:creator: @Mad_Cow Mad Cow
item.description:
@Mad_Cow wrote:

Try this

[scar]// Test FindDeformedBitmapToleranceIn test!
Program FindDeformedBitmapTest;

Var
x, y, x2, y2, Folder : Integer; Accuracy : Extended;

Procedure LoadBMPs;
Begin
Folder := BitmapFromString(14, 11, ‘z78DAADCCB111C0200C03C0’ +
‘95C211825DDAC2DA7FA44046C8A9F9F24946359258C785DC16C69’ +
‘689CFF86340AF97DC72931B7ECB1D2716DB2CD516EC91EBD6E5F6’ +
‘5972AF995A5F0C55EAC4’);
End;

Begin
LoadBMPs;
If(FindDeformedBitmapToleranceIn(Folder, x, y, 0, 0, 10, 10, 10, 5, true, Accuracy))Then
Begin
WriteLn(‘Bitmap was found’);
End Else
Begin
WriteLn(‘Bitmap was not found’);
End;
End.[/scar]

Read full topic

item.title: Help with FindDeformedBitmapToleranceIn function. :(
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

I am having some trouble with the function: FindDeformedBitmapToleranceIn

FindDeformedBitmapToleranceIn(bitmap: Integer; var x, y: Integer; x1, y1, x2, y2: Integer; tolerance: Integer; Range: Integer; AllowPartialAccuracy: Boolean; var accuracy: Extended): Boolean;

That is the syntax, and I’m just wondering why my script won’t work.

Here is the code:
[scar]
// Test FindDeformedBitmapToleranceIn test!
Program FindDeformedBitmapTest;

Var
x, y, x2, y2, Folder : Integer;

Procedure LoadBMPs;
Begin
Folder := BitmapFromString(14, 11, ‘z78DAADCCB111C0200C03C0’ +
‘95C211825DDAC2DA7FA44046C8A9F9F24946359258C785DC16C69’ +
‘689CFF86340AF97DC72931B7ECB1D2716DB2CD516EC91EBD6E5F6’ +
‘5972AF995A5F0C55EAC4’);
End;

Begin
GetClientDimensions(x2, y2);
If(FindDeformedBitmapToleranceIn(Folder, x, y, 0, 0, x2, y2, 10, 5, true, 5))Then
Begin
WriteLn(‘Bitmap was found’);
End Else
Begin
WriteLn(‘Bitmap was not found’);
End;
End.
[/scar]

The error message is…

Line 16: [Error] (16:75): Variable Expected in script

Please help soon. Thank you very much.

~Ron

Read full topic
